  • Field Details

    • VP_CRUST

      public static final double VP_CRUST
      P-wave velocity in Earth's crust. Vp ≈ 6 km/s in upper crust
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • VS_CRUST

      public static final double VS_CRUST
      S-wave velocity (typically Vp/1.73).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Seismology

      public Seismology()

  • Method Details

    • richterMagnitude

      public static double richterMagnitude(double amplitude, double distanceKm)
      Richter magnitude from seismogram amplitude. M_L = log10(A) - log10(A0(δ))
      Parameters:
      amplitude - Maximum amplitude (micrometers)
      distanceKm - Distance to epicenter (km)
      Returns:
      Local magnitude

    • momentMagnitude

      public static double momentMagnitude(double seismicMoment)
      Moment magnitude from seismic moment. M_w = (2/3) * log10(M0) - 10.7
      Parameters:
      seismicMoment - M0 in N·m
      Returns:
      Moment magnitude

    • energyFromMagnitude

      public static double energyFromMagnitude(double magnitude)
      Energy released from magnitude. log10(E) = 1.5*M + 4.8 (E in joules)

    • distanceFromPSTime

      public static double distanceFromPSTime(double deltaT_seconds)
      Estimates distance from P-S time difference. d = Δt / (1/Vs - 1/Vp)

    • pWaveTravelTime

      public static double pWaveTravelTime(double distanceKm)
      Travel time for P-wave.

    • sWaveTravelTime

      public static double sWaveTravelTime(double distanceKm)
      Travel time for S-wave.

    • gutenbergRichter

      public static double gutenbergRichter(double magnitude, double a, double b)
      Gutenberg-Richter relation: frequency-magnitude. log10(N) = a - b*M
      Parameters:
      magnitude - Magnitude threshold
      a - Regional activity level
      b - b-value (typically ~1.0)
      Returns:
      Expected number of earthquakes per year ≥ M

    • mercalliIntensity

      public static int mercalliIntensity(double magnitude, double distanceKm)
      Modified Mercalli Intensity from magnitude and distance. Approximate empirical relation.
